result.execSummary:
The defendant Kody T. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Term of Imprisonment ordered as to Waushara Co Case No 2012CF000013.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain gainful full time employment.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to have no contact with co-defendants Anthony J. Pantalons and/or Amanda P. Pantalons.
No DNA sample and/or surcharge is assessed as Defendant previously provided the same through another felony conviction.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: From Michelle Peterson-VerBruggen to Court

10:05 am cases called-15CF49 & 16CF12. Defendant Kody T. Peterson in court with attorney Jonathan Thomas Groh.  Defendant Kody T. Peterson in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation Order and Warrant received by both counsel-corrections added to record by Attorney Groh. No corrections or material additions by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Groh.  No statement by defendant prior to sentencing. Court makes statement prior to sentencing. Court sentences the defendant to: 15CF49 on Each count-3 years WSP to be served as 18 mo IC & 18 mo ES. Concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence. 239 days credit for time served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs re-imposed to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 16CF12- 3 years WSP to be served as 18 mo IC & 18 mo ES, consecutive to 15CF 49 & 12CF13. Credit for 169 days for time served. CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through,   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. Costs re-imposed to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Court finds defendant eligible for CIP & SAP. Appeal Rights Given.

records.addlTxt: 12CF-3 and 15CF-49 - Cases Called @ 2:30 PM: Defendant Kody T. Peterson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by DA.  Def and SPD confirm State's recital - argued terms on SEHR penalty as to 12CF-3.   15CF-49 - Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CF-49 Ct 1 Plea:   NC  Ct 2 Plea:   NC   Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 3 DRI.  Repeater Enhancers attached to each Count also dismissed.    12CF-13:  Parties admit receipt of Rev Order and Warrant.  No factual corrections offered.  Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  12CF-13 SEHR:  DA argues for a total period of imprisonment of 3 yrs - 1 yr IC/2 yrs ES with 265 days TS credit.  Argument by SPD - agrees with recommendation as to 15CF-49.  As to 12CF-13 - argues against bifurcated SEH - not enough time for any programming - requests time served sentence be imposed of 9 mos.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  Court has direct discussion with Def.  The Court:  12CF-13:  Imposes 3 yr term of imprisonment bifurcated 1 yr IC/2 yrs ES. 265 days TS credit - approx 3 mos and 10 days left to serve.  15CF-49:  S/W as to both Counts - 3 yrs probation.  Concurrent to SEHR 12CF-13.  Conditions of ES and Probation:  AODA and any follow thru, the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Maintain full time gainful employment; 15CF49 Buy Money of $780 to be repaid - Court Costs w/DNA surcharge as to both cases.  No DNA Sample ordered.  12CF-13 Court Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid.  No Contact with co-defendants, Anthony and/or Amanda Pantalons.    Appeal Rights Given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 08-18-2015 02:30 pm
Status conference at 08-04-2015 09:05 am

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests additional status in a couple of weeks.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:05 am.
Status conference at 06-23-2015 09:00 am

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 2:36 p.m. Defendant Kody T. Peterson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted- reading wiaved. NG plea entered as to all counts. DA Blader requesting $2000 Sig Bond.  Atty Szilagyi takes no position on bond. Court orders $2000 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
